items.title: Global Privacy Control, a new Privacy Standard Proposal, now Available in Brave’s Desktop and Android Testing Versions
items.desc: Brave authors and implements a new proposal for opting users out of online tracking.

items.title: WebBundles Harmful to Content Blocking, Security Tools, and the Open Web (Standards Updates #2)
items.desc: WebBundles are extremely bad for researchers, blocking tools, and folks hoping to preserve a user-editable web.

items.title: What’s Brave Done For My Privacy Lately #5: Grab Bag
items.desc: Description of new query-param filters, referrer policy changes, and removing the Reporting API from Brave

items.title: What’s Brave Done For My Privacy Lately? Episode #4: Fingerprinting Defenses 2.0
items.desc: Description of all the features included in Brave's new, randomization based fingerprinting defenses.

items.title: What’s Brave Done For My Privacy Lately? Episode #3: Fingerprint Randomization
items.desc: Introduction to Brave moving from 'consistent response' to 'randomized response' based fingerprinting defenses.

items.title: What’s Brave Done For My Privacy Lately? Episode #2: Third-Party Cosmetic Filtering
items.desc: Description of Brave's unique approach to cosmetic filtering, which heuristically only hides third party ads.

items.title: What’s Brave Done For My Privacy Lately-Episode #1: Web Resource Replacements
items.desc: Description of the technique and benefits of resource replacements in Brave.

items.title: Brave, Fingerprinting, and Privacy Budgets
items.desc: Discussion of why Google's Privacy Budget proposal for combating browser fingerprinting would not be effective, and what alternatives Brave is pursuing.

items.title: Privacy Anti-Patterns In Standards
items.desc: Description of several privacy-harming patterns observed as part of PING, the W3C's privacy review group, how these anti-patterns make it difficult to protect user privacy on the web.

items.title: Brave's Concerns with the Client-Hints Proposal
items.desc: Discussion of concerns with the proposed Client Hints standard, and why it would be harmful for web privacy.

items.title: Understanding Redirection-Based Tracking
items.desc: Blog post description research lead at Brave regarding the frequency and parties involved in bounce-tracking. Conducted as part of designing Brave's improvements to Safari's Intelligent Tracking Prevention 2.0.

items.title: The Mounting Cost of Stale Ad Blocking Rules
items.desc: Blog post describing research lead at Brave regarding the number and cost of the accumulation of stale rules in EasyList.
